=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
  SpriteSet
    floor > Immovable randomtiling=0.9 img=oryx/floor3 hidden=True
    goal  > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/doorclosed1
    key   > Immovable color=ORANGE img=oryx/key2
    sword > OrientedFlicker limit=5 singleton=True img=oryx/slash1
    movable >
      avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8
        nokey   > img=oryx/swordman1
        withkey > color=ORANGE img=oryx/swordmankey1
      enemy >  
        monsterQuick > RandomNPC cooldown=2 cons=6 img=oryx/bat1
        monsterNormal > RandomNPC cooldown=4 cons=8 img=oryx/spider2
        monsterSlow > RandomNPC cooldown=8 cons=12 img=oryx/scorpion1
      wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/wall3
      	

  LevelMapping
    g > floor goal
    + > floor key        
    A > floor nokey
    1 > floor monsterQuick
    2 > floor monsterNormal
    3 > floor monsterSlow
    w > wall
    . > floor
    

  InteractionSet
    movable wall  > stepBack
    nokey goal    > stepBack
    goal withkey  > killSprite scoreChange=1
    enemy sword > killSprite scoreChange=2
    enemy enemy > stepBack
    avatar enemy > killSprite scoreChange=-1
    nokey key     > transformTo stype=withkey scoreChange=1 killSecond=True

  TerminationSet
    SpriteCounter stype=goal   win=True
    SpriteCounter stype=avatar win=False
This is vgdl rule in natural language:
Here's an overview of the game and some ideas for how to approach it:

• Genre and Style
 – This is a tile‐based puzzle/action adventure. You're navigating through a maze-like level with a mix of combat and collection challenges.
 – The graphics are sprite‐based, and the game uses simple interactions (collisions and transformations) to drive gameplay.

• Core Game Mechanics
 – Movement & Environment: You move an avatar around a grid filled with walls, floors, and obstacles. Walls and other immovable sprites prevent movement, forcing you to find the right route.
 – Key Collection & Transformation: Your character starts in a “nokey” state. By colliding with a key, you transform into “withkey”. This is essential for unlocking the goal.
 – Door (Goal) Interaction: With the key in hand and in your “withkey” state, you can interact with the door (the goal) to complete the level.
 – Combat: You have a sword (flickering, limited to a few uses at a time) that you can shoot. Using the sword against enemies can kill them and score points, but colliding directly with enemies (or with the avatar hitting an enemy without the sword) penalizes you.
 – Enemies & Monsters: The level features different types of roaming enemies (some fast, some slow). They wander randomly with varying cooldowns, so timing and positioning are crucial.

• Objective and Win/Loss Conditions
 – Objective: Collect the key to transform your avatar (so you have the key) and then reach the door to finish the level. Along the way, you can kill enemies with your sword for bonus points.
 – Win Condition: The level is won when you’ve triggered the door interaction (contact between the door and a “withkey” avatar), which also increases your score.
 – Loss Condition: You lose if your avatar is killed—direct collisions with enemies hurt you, and if all instances of your avatar disappear, the level ends in failure.

• Overall Strategy
 1. Assess the Level Layout: Look at the maze of walls and plan a path that will take you from your starting point to the key, and then onto the door (goal). Be mindful of choke points where enemies might block your path.
 2. Key First: Prioritize picking up the key to transform into the “withkey” state. This transformation is required to interact successfully with the door.
 3. Manage Enemies: Decide when to engage or avoid enemies. You can use your sword to kill enemies, scoring extra points when needed, but remember that sword uses are limited and timing is key. Avoid direct collisions to prevent point losses.
 4. Use the Environment: The walls and other static sprites can block enemy movement, so use them to your advantage. Navigate around enemy patrol areas and make use of any safe zones.
 5. Timing & Precision: Because enemies (including fast-moving ones) wander around randomly, timing your moves and attacks is important. If you see a vulnerable enemy, a well-timed sword strike can clear your path.
 6. Balance Risk and Reward: Sometimes, eliminating an enemy might be necessary for a clear route, while other times a stealthy avoidance strategy works better. Weigh the potential score gains from killing an enemy against the risk of taking damage.

In summary, you'll be solving a spatial puzzle by finding the right route, collecting the required key, and using your combat abilities to deal with roaming enemies. Planning your movements and timing your attacks will be crucial to reaching the door and winning the level—all while keeping an eye on your score and health.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
